A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
When George Lucas was making Star War movies\, all he wanted is to tell his story\, when Disney makes Star War movies\, all they want is to get that $4 billion back and make more.

Disney doesn't have a story to tell\, the whole movie is a mixture of subplots each serving a different marketing strategy. Nostalgia to sell tickets to fans\, cute animals to sell toys\, feminism to pander to the PC culture and meaningless jokes for schmucks.

The most disgraceful part is that Disney brings the old heroes back\, only to make them old\, fat\, miserable and died in meanless ways. Disney has no respect for them\, they're just there to sell tickets.

This is not a Star Wars movie but a Disney movie to lure Star Wars fans. Compare this movie to the originals is like comparing cola to wine\, looks similar but tastes very differently. 

I'm done with this cash cow\, Disney can sell tickets and movie products to those who claim they like this movie\, I won't go to see another Disney Star Wars movie again.
